channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Universal Credit: Families must choose food or fuel in benefits cut
item.description: Mothers on strict budgets and a poverty charity call for the universal credit boost to remain.

item.title: Manic Street Preachers: 'A Design For Life saved us'
item.description: The Welsh band on Trojan horse tracks, losing Richey Edwards and finding a new piano-pop direction.

item.title: Barmouth Bridge to receive further £30m upgrades
item.description: Barmouth's 154-year-old bridge doesn't have much from its original build, but is still going strong.

item.title: Betsi Cadwaladr health board cancels some surgery amid Covid rise
item.description: The north Wales health board has also decided to ban visitors except in "exceptional" circumstances.

item.title: Covid: Wales vaccine passport decision due next week
item.description: It comes as Wales' first minister warns daily Covid hospital admissions could more than double.

item.title: Four men who died during Severn Bridge works honoured with plaque
item.description: Kevin Hoskins, John Short, Eric Sullivan and Robin Phelps died while working on the bridge.

item.title: Motorcyclist dies following crash with car on A493
item.description: A male motorcyclist in his 70s died at the scene of the crash in Gwynedd, police say.

item.title: Stereophonics tickets are on sale for six times their value
item.description: The Cwmaman band will play two nights with Tom Jones and Catfish and The Bottlemen in Cardiff.

item.title: Three Ds Mining fined £100,000 after miner crushed by roof
item.description: Gwyn Woodland fractured his back when the roof of the mine he was working in collapsed.

item.title: Afghanistan: First refugees arrive in Wales after Taliban coup
item.description: Those arriving in the country have directly supported Welsh-based armed forces in Afghanistan.

item.title: 9/11: Husband of Welsh victim to be played in Netflix film
item.description: Charles Wolf's wife Katherine was killed while working in the World Trade Center's north tower.

item.title: Bute park: More than 50 trees destroyed in vandalism
item.description: Thousands of pounds of damage caused after "extensive vandalism" at a popular Welsh park.

item.title: Afghan refugees 'leave everything behind and have nothing'
item.description: Wales' Afghan community have been collecting clothes, shoes, toys and nappies for children.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No vaccine passports needed for public services
item.description: The Welsh government is considering whether vaccine passports should be introduced in some settings.

item.title: Endometriosis: 'I thought I would die from period blood loss'
item.description: Anna Cooper was told was nothing wrong but has now had 13 surgeries due to endometriosis.

item.title: Climbing: All-women Pinnacle Club celebrates its centenary
item.description: An all-women club for climbers marks its centenary where it began - in Snowdonia.

item.title: Lynette White murder: Man falsely accused relives 'nightmare'
item.description: Five men spent time in prison after being wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: World 12s 'approaches already made' for teams - ex-WRU chairman Davies
item.description: Organisers of the proposed World 12s tournament have already been approached by people keen to form a franchise, according to one of its backers.

item.title: Gareth Anscombe: Wales fly-half makes Ospreys debut at Northampton
item.description: Wales fly-half Gareth Anscombe finally returns after his 25-month knee injury in Ospreys' pre-season friendly at Northampton on Friday.

item.title: Cardiff City: Mick McCarthy delighted to keep Kieffer Moore
item.description: Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy admits he is surprised that Wales and Bluebirds forward Kieffer Moore remains with the Championship club.

item.title: Swansea City: Head coach Russell Martin used the international break as a 'mini pre-season'
item.description: Head coach Russell Martin says the international break provided time for important squad development after a hectic first month in charge.

item.title: Harrogate Town 2-2 Newport County
item.description: Harrogate stay top of League Two as they twice hit back in a hard-fought encounter to deny Newport County.

item.title: Colli budd-dal: 'Pobl yn gorfod dewis rhwng bwyd a gwres'
item.description: Elusen yn rhybuddio y bydd teuluoedd yn dioddef os ydy'r toriad i gredyd cynhwysol yn mynd yn ei flaen.

item.title: Dyn busnes i fuddsoddi £200,000 ym maes awyr Abertawe
item.description: Cafodd trwydded y maes awyr ei atal yn 2019, ond mae'r dyn sy'n rhedeg y safle yn buddsoddi ynddo.

item.title: Y GIG dan bwysau a gohirio gwasanaethau'n 'debygol'
item.description: Daw rhybudd Conffederasiwn GIG Cymru wrth i fwrdd iechyd y gogledd ohirio rhai llawdriniaethau.

item.title: Al Lewis: Y galar a'r gân
item.description: "Mi oedd hi fel bo' Dad 'mond wedi marw wythnos d'wetha, dyna sut ma'r galar yn medru'ch taro chi weithie."

item.title: Adran Dau: Harrogate 2-2 Casnewydd
item.description: Casnewydd a Harrogate yn gorfod bodloni ar bwynt yr un yn dilyn gêm gyfartal yng ngogledd Lloegr.
